results.title: Special Effects
results.brief_description: This thoroughly entertaining program takes the viewer on a behind the scenes look at such special effects blockbusters as “Blade Runner”, “The Right Stuff”, “The Empire Strikes Back” and “Return of the Jedi” along with examples of the latest work being done in computer generated imagery, video games and sound effects. Narrated by Robin King.

results.title: Special effects
results.brief_description: Provides an intriguing look at certain special effects employed by Oxford Scientific Films mainly in their biological and scientific productions. Also shows the scientific effects generated for some science fiction films. Highlights the need to plan and set up shots well.

results.title: Special delivery
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb, John Weldon and Eunice Macaulay
results.brief_description: Special Delivery looks like a detective story and sounds like a soap opera. A series of misadventures stretches the imagination to its limits, as Alice and Ralph Phelps battle with the snow and the dead mailman. A comic moral tale which warns of the perils of the slippery slope! Winner of the 1979 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

results.title: Special delivery
results.brief_description: Features the varied birth experiences of three first-time couples, focusing on the first stage of labour. The couples are interviewed prior to, and after, birth to see how reality matched their expectations and how the skills acquired helped them cope.

results.title: Speaking up
results.creator_credit: F-Reel Pty Ltd, Louise Hubbard and Fiona Cochrane
results.brief_description: A documentary aimed at raising the level of awareness regarding issues of sexual assault against women; exploring rights, legal processes, resources and services available to sexual assault victims in Victoria. Issues covered include dispelling commonly believed myths about sexual assault, where to go if raped, surviving rape, the rape victim’s legal rights, the role of the police, counselling and support services available to victims and societal attitudes to sexual assault and violence in our community. The program seeks to empower women by informing them of their rights, resources and services. This program was produced to assist professionals across Australia working directly or indirectly with victims of sexual assault, the general community and school students to better understand the facts about rape.

results.title: Speaking our peace
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bonnie Sherr Klein and Margaret Pettigrew
results.brief_description: A documentary about women, peace and power. Greenham Common, England, was once land belonging to the entire community and used for its common good. Now nine miles of wire fences divide the US Airforce Base from the women and the children they claim to protect. The land is home to 32 guided missiles. Women came to Greenham to challenge the belief that the peace we seek can come from any army. Women speak out in opposition to nuclear weapons.

results.title: Speaking of Harvey
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Film and Video and Eric Friedl
results.brief_description: Considers the issue of animal experimentation in the world of science, as seen through the eyes of a young research scientist working with the liver physiology of de-arterialized livers. He raises he issues of vivisections rather clearly and tries to persuade us that we can carry out these experiments “Humanly”. Raises issues surrounding animal experimentation.

results.title: Speaking of animals: in South America
results.brief_description: Very humorous North American view of Brazilian/South American jungle life. Great early animation technique. Commentary a bit twee but humorous voice-overs depicting Clark Gable and Ma Kettle give it a great touch. Animation by George Grimshaw. Narration by Ken Carpenter.
